text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.25.8, Estate and Gift Tax, Delinquent Returns and Substitute for Return Procedures.
Signiﬁcant changes to this IRM are listed below:

IRM Reference Description of Change IRM 4.25.8.1.2 Additional authorities were added to paragraphs (1) and (9). IRM 4.25.8.1.4 Additional terms and acronyms were added to the table following paragraph (1). IRM 4.25.8.1.4 Deﬁnitions were added for the following terms: non-delinquent return, delinquent return, and sub- stitute for return. IRM 4.25.8.1.5 Additional IRM and Document citations were added to the list of related resources. IRM 4.25.8.2.1, paragraph (4), IRM 4.25.8.4.1 paragraph (4), and IRM 4.25.8.5.1 paragraph (2) The Form 2363 processing contact information was updated with a link to the Estate and Gift Knowledge Management, Contact Listing for Internal E&G Forms page. IRM 4.25.8.2.1, paragraph (6), IRM 4.25.8.4.1 paragraph (7), and IRM 4.25.8.5.1 paragraph (4), 2nd bullet The citation to IRM 4.25.14.11.1 was replaced with a citation to Document 6209, Section 12.5.10. IRM 4.25.8.2.2 paragraph (3), IRM 4.25.8.4.2 paragraph (5), IRM 4.25.8.4.4.1 paragraph (9), IRM 4.25.8.4.4.2 paragraph (9), IRM 4.25.8.4.4.3 paragraph (11), IRM 4.25.8.5.3.1 paragraph (8) and IRM 4.25.8.5.3.2 paragraph (8) The address citation was replaced with a link to the Estate and Gift Knowledge Management, Contact Listing for Internal E&G Forms page. IRM 4.25.8.2.3 IRM 4.25.8.2.3, Examination Procedures for Non- Delinquent Pickup Returns was obsoleted. This information is contained in IRM 4.25.6. IRM 4.25.8.2.4 IRM 4.25.8.2.4, Case Closing Procedures for Non- Delinquent Pickup Returns was obsoleted. This information is contained in IRM 4.25.10.

subsection. This subsection contains introductory information that was contained in the obsoleted Estate and Gift Project Case Job Aid. The IRM subsection describes existing procedures and provides citations to existing guidance located in IRM 4.25.3 and IRM 4.4.9. IRM 4.25.8.4 • The title was revised from “Introduction to Delinquent Returns” to “Delinquent Returns” • The deﬁnition contained in paragraph (1) was moved to IRM 4.25.8.1.4 paragraph 2. • Paragraph 2 was revised to replace the citation to the obsoleted E&G Project Case Job aid with a citation to IRM 4.4.9. The pro- cedures described in the obsoleted Job Aid are in IRM 4.4.9. IRM 4.25.8.4.2 The subsection title was revised by removing the word “pickup”. IRM 4.25.8.5 paragraph (3) Paragraph 3 was revised. The citation to the obsoleted E&G Project Case Job Aid was replaced with a citation to IRM 4.4.9. The procedures described in the obsoleted Job Aid are in IRM 4.4.9. IRM 4.25.8.5 paragraph (7) Paragraph 7 was obsoleted. This information is contained in IRM 4.4.9.2.3.1. IRM 4.25.8.5.3 4.25.8.5.3 contains a new paragraph (2). Paragraph 2 provides a citation to existing AIMS case processing and closure procedures located in IRM 4.4.9. IRM 4.25.8.6 paragraph (1) The content that was in IRM 4.25.8.6.1 paragraphs (1) and (2) were moved to 4.25.8.6 paragraph (1). EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This section contains instructions and guidelines for Small Business/Self Employed (SBSE) Estate and Gift Tax Specialty Programs employees.
Kellie L. McCann
Acting Director, Specialty Examination Policy Small Business/Self-Employed
Table of Contents
Program Scope and Objectives
Agreed with Adjustments and Change to Tax Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent
4.25.8.6 Project Cases

) General Overview - This IRM provides general information about basic estate and gift tax examiner responsibilities, estate and gift tax IRM sections, and forms used in the examination of estate, gift and generation-skipping transfer tax returns and claims. (

) Purpose - This IRM explains Estate and Gift Tax examiner responsibilities that managers, senior-level officials and estate, gift and generation-skipping transfer tax return examiners will be better equipped to prepare and submit accurate reports. (
) Audience - This IRM is for Estate and Gift Specialty Tax managers, examiners and personnel at the campus who process estate, gift and generation-skipping transfer tax returns, refunds and claims. (

) Policy Owner - Director, Examination - Specialty Policy is responsible for the administration, procedures and updates related to the technical guidance and information processing steps and methods speciﬁc to Estate and Gift Tax examiner responsibilities, IRM subsections, and forms created for the examina- tion of returns and claims. (
) Program Owner - Director, Examination - Specialty Examination owns Estate and Gift Tax Examination. (

) Primary Stakeholders - Advisory Collections, Appeals, Counsel, Estate and Gift Tax Workload Selection and Delivery, Specialty Examination, and SB/SE Exam Quality & Technical Support are the primary stakeholders for this IRM. (
) IRM text pertains to Estate and Gift Tax procedures for delinquent returns, stitute for returns and project cases. This IRM provides direction which is Estate and Gift Tax speciﬁc. (
) The IRS has the authority to conduct examinations under Title
, Internal Revenue Code, Subtitle F - Procedure and Administration, Chapter
, Discovery of Liability and Enforcement of Title, Subchapter A, Examination Inspection. Additional Authority or conducting an examination is contained in the
CFR
, Examination of returns and claims for refund, credit or abatement, determination of the correct tax liability. (

) Estate and gift tax examiners and managers assigned to examine and oversee the examination of estate and gift tax returns and issues are responsible for complying with servicewide policies and authorities set forth in IRM
, Servicewide Policies and Authorities, Policy Statements for the Examining Process. (
) Examination of estate and gift tax returns should be conducted in a manner that will promote public conﬁdence as stated in the Mission of the Service. IRM
, Policy Statement
) Policy Statement
established a general guideline that examination and processing of returns should be completed within
months of the ﬁling date. See IRM
, Policy Statement

) Estate and Gift Tax examiners and managers assigned to examine and oversee the examination of international estate and gift tax returns and issues are responsible for complying with all applicable servicewide examination del- egation orders and SB/SE delegation orders. of RRA
, Public Law

requires the Service to include an explanation of the examination and collection process, as well as informa- tion about assistance from the Taxpayer Advocate with any ﬁrst report/notice proposed deﬁciency. Pub
, The Examination Process, must be used for this purpose. (
) Statement of Procedural Rules

requires that examiners forward to taxpayer any correspondence (or copy), discussions, reports and/or other material that are sent to the representative. Examiners should forward such materials at the same time they are sent to the representative. (

return instructions and CFR

list required ﬁling documents. (
) The following additional authorities provide the basis for examining and estab- lishing substitute for returns: • IRC
, Returns prepared for or executed by Secretary • IRC
, Limits on Credit or Refund • Privacy Act of
• Freedom of Information Act • Taxpayer Bill of Rights • Fair Tax Collection Processes Act (

) The National Quality Review System (NQRS) is a web-based review system used by Estate and Gift Tax Policy, Field and Specialty Exam Quality(FSEQ) generate and review reports analyzing national quality performance based upon standardized quality attributes set forth in Document

, Estate and Gift Tax Examination Embedded Quality Job Aid. NQRS report data is compiled by QMA on a quarterly basis, but ad hoc reports may be obtained monthly. The use of NQRS is explained in additional detail in IRM
, Manager Embedded Quality Review and Specialty Exam National Embedded Quality Review Programs and IRM
, Guidelines for SB/SE National Quality Review. (

) Operational Reviews and related NQRS reports are conducted by Territory Managers and the Chief of Estate and Gift to measure national adherence to quality standards and managerial performance and/or oversight. (

) Customer (i.e. taxpayer) satisfaction reports are generated by SB/SE Operation Support Research on a quarterly basis. These reports provide masked taxpayer narratives that are responsive to a pre-deﬁned set of survey questions. The quarterly survey reports are to be used to identify areas for amination quality improvement. (
) Frequent Front-line manager reviews are conducted under the Examination Quality Review System (EQRS), with the frequency based on annual personnel requirements.
gift delegation orders is available at IRM 4.25.14.10, Estate and Gift Tax, Mis- cellaneous Procedures, Signature Authority.

) Upon receipt of a non-delinquent return, verify the following items are completed: • Verify the correct name, address, and SSN are reﬂected on the tax return with no strikeovers. • Date stamp the original return with the date received using an official date received stamp. Save the envelope showing the post marked date. (
) Verify the presence of the taxpayer’s signature and date the return was signed. (
) Verify all required forms and schedules are present and the computations are correct. (
) Using IDRS command code INOLES, determine whether an entity has been established for the taxpayer on Master File for a BMF account using an SSN with a “V” deﬁner (MFT
or MFT

-D Examination Request-ERCS (Examination Returns Control System) Users, to the group secretary for input. Non-Delinquent Returns (
) The examiner must retain a copy of the secured tax return to use as a copy until the original return is processed at the Campus and sent back to examiner. (
) Notate in red at the top of the return copy “Copy of Return” and include in case ﬁle. Do not make any marks on the original tax return. (
) The original return secured must be processed at the Campus. Send the original return using Form
, Document Transmittal, to Submission Pro- cessing . See Estate and Gift Knowledge Management, Contact Listing for ternal E&G Forms for the current mailing address. (
) If payment is made with the original return, the payment should be sent the original return for processing. Notate Form
, Document Transmittal, with payment information. Project Cases (
) Non-ﬁler project cases are developed by WSD with case building done prior sending the case to the ﬁeld. A Transaction Code (TC)
SFR is established on AIMS prior to the case being sent to Field Examination. The case ﬁle or may not include an original tax return at the time of assignment. (
) When a case has a TC
SFR posted at the time of assignment, the following case processing characteristics also apply: • No TC
SFR assessment amounts have been entered on the File or Non-Master File account. • A TC

is present on the account indicating an open record. • In general, the closing procedures for project cases will be determined based on whether there is “further examination potential” after a quent return is secured (

, Examining Process, AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Delinquent and Substitute for Return Processing, provides processing, examining and closing procedures for cases with a TC
SFR present on open module. Returns (

SFR is present on the open module for the same tax period, IRM

, Examining Process, AIMS Procedures and Processing Instructions, Delinquent and Substitute for Return Processing, for processing, examining and closing procedures. This section applies to delinquent returns where tax module or controls have been established for the tax period.

Delinquent Returns and SFR Procedures 4.25.8 page

) If a return or returns are determined to be required, the examiner will ascertain the reasons why the taxpayer failed to ﬁle the required returns and determine whether any indications of fraud exist. (

) When information is developed during an examination that indicates the tax- payer’s failure to ﬁle a required return or returns is willful, or if there is any other indication of fraud, the case will be referred pursuant to the direction Fraud Technical Advisor (FTA). In such cases the examiner will not solicit quent returns, payment of tax, or any agreement from the taxpayer. If the taxpayer furnishes delinquent returns to the examiner or indicates he/she intends to ﬁle delinquent returns, the examiner will notify Criminal Investigation through proper channels. See IRM
, Fraud Handbook - Failure to File. (

) If it is determined that indications of fraud are not present, the taxpayer will advised that he/she is required to ﬁle all delinquent returns without regard the number of years or taxable periods involved. The taxpayer will be asked deliver the returns promptly to the examiner. The examiner should also solicit payment of the liabilities, if any. (
) The examiner will set a speciﬁc date for receiving the return(s). The date should be reasonable in light of the facts and circumstances in the case. Entity and Delinquent (

, Address, and IRM
, SSN/EIN. • Date stamp the original return with the date received using an official date received stamp. Save the envelope showing the post marked (

) Delinquent returns must be processed in order to establish an account module on master ﬁle. The amounts reported on the delinquent return are input into master ﬁle. The starting point for an examination report are the amounts reported from the delinquent return. Complete the steps outlined in paragraphs (
) through (
) to process the delinquent return pick up. (
) Make a copy of the delinquent tax return to maintain in the case ﬁle. On the copy, write in red on the top margin, “COPY OF RETURN”. (
) On the original return, write in red on the top margin, “DELINQUENT RETURN SECURED BY EXAMINATION”. The original return will not be returned to the group. (
) Attach a completed Form

, Expedite Processing Cycle, to the front of EACH return, paying special attention to the following: • Check the box for “DELINQUENT RETURN”. • If there are multiple tax periods for the same taxpayer, indicate on the ﬁrst Form
, “Block Together-Related Tax Periods-Do Not Separate”. • If penalties are to be assessed, make NO notations in the penalty area of the Form

Failure to pay (FTP), failure to deposit (FTD), failure to ﬁle (FTF), and estimated tax penalty (ETP), are all automatically computer generated and assessed if applicable. • If no penalties are to be assessed, check the appropriate box(es) under the BMF column. • Contact information may be the examiner or group secretary. with a Form
to Sub- mission Processing. See Estate and Gift Knowledge Management, Contact Listing for Internal E&G Forms for the current mailing address.

) Submission of the package will post the Transaction Code (TC)
The examiner will monitor the account using BMFOLT to ensure a TC
posts the account. When the TC
posts, AIMS and ERCS will become full records. If AIMS and ERCS do not become full records within
weeks, the steps outlined below must be followed. • Review TXMOD. • If pending (PN) TC
, wait
weeks for the TC
to post. • If rejected (RJ) TC
, the return may not post for some time. Contact your AIMS/ERCS coordinator for assistance. • If after
weeks there is no record of a posted TC
, pending TC
, rejected TC
or unposted TC
, resubmit the return to submission processing. Notate on the copy of the return “Original return was lost, process as original”.
) Examination Procedures for Delinquent Returns (
) Upon receipt of a delinquent return, the examiner and group manager will determine whether a further examination of the delinquent return is necessary. (

) In all cases, the examiner should prepare a Report of Examination Changes (Report) using the Estate and Gift Notebook starting with the amounts from delinquent return to reﬂect tax, credits, etc. per return. (
) The examiner will need to wait until the TC
posts before proceeding with an examination or commencing closing procedures found at IRM
, Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Returns.
) Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Returns (

) One of the speciﬁc closing procedures below should be followed to ensure proper closing of a delinquent return: • No Further Examination. Use these procedures when no further exami- nation is required. See IRM

, No Further Examination Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Returns. • Agreed with Adjustments and No Change to Tax. Use these procedures when the delinquent return requires a further examination and the addi- tional adjustments are agreed but there is no change to tax. This includes a change to the uniﬁed credit reported on the delinquent return. See IRM

, Agreed with Adjustments, No Change to Tax Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Returns. • Agreed with Adjustments and Change to Tax. Use these procedures when the delinquent return requires a further examination and the result of the continued examination is an agreement with adjustments and changes to tax. See IRM
, Agreed with Adjustments and Change to Tax Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Pickup Returns. • Unagreed cases. See IRM
, Unagreed Case Closing Proce- dures for Delinquent Returns. • For amended returns ﬁled to correct delinquent returns refer to IRM
, Amended Delinquent Returns.
) No Further Examination Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Returns (

) In addition to the standard closing documents and procedures, special proce- dures referenced in this section are required for closing delinquent pickups where there is no change to the tax due and/or to the uniﬁed credit as origi- nally ﬁled. The return is being accepted as ﬁled. Cat. No.

Upon receipt of a delinquent return, the examiner and group manager will determine whether a further examination of the delinquent return is necessary.
No Further Examination. Use these procedures when no further exami- nation is required. See IRM

, No Further Examination Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Returns. Agreed with Adjustments and No Change to Tax. Use these procedures when the delinquent return requires a further examination and the addi- tional adjustments are agreed but there is no change to tax. This includes a change to the uniﬁed credit reported on the delinquent return. See IRM

, Agreed with Adjustments, No Change to Tax Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Returns. Agreed with Adjustments and Change to Tax. Use these procedures when the delinquent return requires a further examination and the result of the continued examination is an agreement with adjustments and changes to tax. See IRM
, Agreed with Adjustments and Change to Tax Case Closing Procedures for Delinquent Pickup Returns. Unagreed cases. See IRM
, Unagreed Case Closing Proce- dures for Delinquent Returns. For amended returns ﬁled to correct delinquent returns refer to IRM
, Amended Delinquent Returns.

dures referenced in this section are required for closing delinquent pickups where there is no change to the tax due and/or to the uniﬁed credit as origi
nally ﬁled. The return is being accepted as ﬁled.

) In certain situations, the ﬁling of an amended return to correct a delinquent return requires special attention. When possible, the taxpayer should be in- structed to ﬁle directly with the examiner. (
) If a taxpayer ﬁled a delinquent return with an examiner, then wants to ﬁle an amended return for the same tax period, the examiner should hold the amended return until the TC
posts on the delinquent return. After the TC
posts, the examiner may consider any changes reﬂected in the amended return and make the necessary adjustments. (
) If a taxpayer ﬁles an amended return with the campus, then TC
X will be posted. This reﬂects the receipt of the return and generates an “-A” freeze the account. Note: If the “-A” is on the account, it cannot be closed as a non-examined closure.

Note: If the “-A” is on the account, it cannot be closed as a non-examined closure. The “-A” freeze has to be resolved.
to for Return (

) When a taxpayer refuses to ﬁle a required tax return, the Service has the option of preparing the tax return for the taxpayer which is categorized as a Substitute for Return (SFR). This is often accomplished by preparing an Ex- amination Report or completing a tax return for the taxpayer’s signature. If the taxpayer signs a Report prepared by an examiner, it is not considered a tax return and SFR procedures are followed. If the taxpayer signs an actual tax return prepared by the examiner, the return is considered a delinquent return and delinquent return procedures should be followed. See IRM
, Intro- duction to Delinquent Pickup Returns. (

) Follow the procedures set forth in this section when the tax return due date and extended due date have passed and all efforts have been exhausted to secure a required tax return from a taxpayer that is not part of a project and does not have a TC
or TC
SFR posting on AIMS. (
) If Transaction Code (TC)
SFR is present on the open module for the same tax period, consult IRM

, Examining Process, AIMS Procedures and Pro- cessing Instructions, Delinquent and Substitute for Return Processing, for processing, examining and closing procedures. This section applies to substi- tute returns where no controls have been established for the tax period. (

) Substitute for Return (SFR) procedures in this section are valid when the examiner prepares a Report of Examination Changes (Report) for presentation to the taxpayer in lieu of a tax return. The examiner will present the Report to the taxpayer for signature. If the taxpayer signs the Report, the Report serves as an agreement. If no signature is secured on the Report, unagreed closing procedures in this section should be followed. (
) SFR procedures should not be used when the due date for ﬁling (including any valid extensions) has not yet passed. (

) Since the ﬁling of a tax return starts the assessment statute expiration date, not change the statute date. It remains as “EE”. Note: If a statute date for a substitute for return is inadvertently changed to a numerical date, it can be reversed by changing the date back to “EE” and adding Aging Reason Code
However, do not use Aging Reason Code
Note: If a statute date for a substitute for return is inadvertently changed to a numerical date, it can be reversed by changing the date back to “EE” and adding Aging Reason Code
However, do not use Aging Reason Code
until a report is issued showing that the “EE” has been overlaid with a numerical date. Continue to monitor the record until the statute date is valid with an “EE.”

conclusion of an SFR examination the examiner must prepare and sign Form 13496, IRC Section 6020(b) Certiﬁcation. Prepare and date the certiﬁcation (Form 13496) after the 30-day letter (or revised 30-day letter), report summa- rizing exam changes, or equivalent report of adjustments so that the date of the certiﬁcation is identical to, or later than, the 30-day letter, report of exam changes or equivalent report of adjustments.

ment results in the resolution of the tax at issue. Since the United States Tax Court is a court of limited jurisdiction, the court may exercise jurisdiction only to the extent expressly provided by Congress. See IRC 7442. IRC 6213 confers jurisdiction on the Tax Court to redetermine deﬁciencies in income, estate, gift, and certain excise taxes. The provision which confers jurisdiction on the court to review an addition to tax for late ﬁling is IRC 6665. If no part of the determined addition-to-tax or penalty is attributable to a tax deﬁciency, the Tax Court no longer has jurisdiction to decide the merits of the addition-to-tax or penalty. See Forgey v. Commissioner , 115 TC 142 (2000). A statutory notice of deﬁciency cannot be issued for the addition-to-tax or penalty. The case will be closed as an agreed case, with all penalty assessment information recorded on the Form 3198 and Form 5344. See IRM 4.25.10, Case Closing Proce- dures. The taxpayer may appeal the penalty after assessment.

) The examiner should wait to close the electronic IMS penalty case ﬁle until the expiration of the unagreed penalty protest period established in the Letter
-S. The examiner should document the protest period deadline, and any extensions in the IMS penalty case Activity Record, Form

a. If the taxpayer does not submit a protest by the response deadline the examiner should synchronize and close the electronic case on IMS. b. If the Taxpayer submits a protest within the required response timeframe the examiner should close the unagreed penalty case issues to appeals for determination. See IRM
, Closure of the Unagreed Portion.
b. If the Taxpayer submits a protest within the required response timeframe the examiner should close the unagreed penalty case issues to appeals for determination. See IRM

) Project cases are cases developed by WSD. Project cases may also be the result of referrals. Case building is started prior to sending the case to the ﬁeld. A module is open on IDRS with a Transaction Code (TC)
SFR posted. The remainder of the record is blank. Only cases with a TC

SFR at the time of assignment are considered project cases for purposes of determining which guidance to follow for processing and closing the cases. Once Substitute for Return (SFR) procedures are started, they cannot be changed. The return controlled as an SFR must be processed as such through ﬁnal closure whether or not a return is secured. This is the fundamental difference between project cases and regular examinations. (
) In addition to this IRM, information on project cases may also be found on Estate and Gift Shar
oint or by contacting the WSD Project Coordinator. IRM
, Classiﬁcation of Non-Filer and Under-reporter Project Cases, which provides WSD Coordinator procedures for project cases. (

) At the time a project case is assigned, speciﬁc background and procedures may be provided on a Case Insert distributed with the case ﬁle. Some project cases have speciﬁc lead sheets, letters and forms developed for use by the examiner during the project. For most projects, Notebook includes letters and forms related to the speciﬁc project. Use of the approved letters and forms is mandatory. They can be found in the Notebook Forms Library in the Project and Delinquent Return Workpapers folder. (

) Project, research and tracked issue cases are identiﬁed with both project and tracking codes. A Project Code is a four digit number indicating that a case belongs to a special program which allows monitoring of the program by project code. AIMS reports can be generated for a given project to measure the total number of returns, examination time, results, etc. See IRM

, Project Codes used in Estate and Gift Tax Examinations. A Tracking Code is a four digit code used to identify speciﬁc categories of returns. Once a Tracking Code has been added, it should not be removed. See IRM
, Tracking Codes used in Estate and Gift Tax Examina- tions. (

) A Project Feedback Form is available in IMS. The purpose of the form is to gather information to improve the quality of project cases sent to the ﬁeld for examination. All responses are conﬁdential and will not be used to evaluate performance.
